intro: Opuntia riviereana, commonly known as the Rivière's prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its flat, fleshy stems that are typically green and covered in spines. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit, known as a tunah, is edible and contains a sweet, juicy pulp. Opuntia riviereana is well adapted to arid environments and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
